SEARCH
Module graphicInterface
Package graph

Class Position

java.lang.Object
graph.Position
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Position extends Object implements Serializable
Position is used for two purposes: to know where a player is on the board, and to create edges for the graph that represents the board.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position(int x, int y) throws BadPositionException
      Constructor method for the Position class.
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate x
      y - coordinate y
      Throws:
      BadPositionException - if x or y is lesser than 0, throws an exception

    • Position

      public Position(int[] ints) throws BadPositionException
      Constructor method for the Position class. This constructor takes an array of ints compared to the default one which takes 2 ints.
      Parameters:
      ints - An array of ints for the position.
      Throws:
      BadPositionException - if x or y is lesser than 0, throws an exception (from the default constructor)

    • toAdjacencyListIndex

      public int toAdjacencyListIndex(int boardSize)
      This method calculates the index of a Position. The index can be used for the adjacency list.
      Parameters:
      boardSize - size of the board.
      Returns:
      the index of a Position.

    • getNeighbourEdges

      public Map<Direction,Edge> getNeighbourEdges(EdgeWeightedGraph graph)
      This method generates a map of Edges connected to a Position. It is useful to know the neighbours of a Position.
      Parameters:
      graph - graph representing the board.
      Returns:
      a Map with every direction and the edge associated with the direction, if the direction exists.

    • getNeighbourPositions

      public Map<Direction,Position> getNeighbourPositions(EdgeWeightedGraph graph)
      This method generates a map of Positions connected to a Position. It is useful to know the neighbours of a Position. We simply reuse getNeighbourEdges and get the target position of every Edge.
      Parameters:
      graph - graph representing the board.
      Returns:
      a Map with every direction and the edge associated with the direction, if the direction exists.

    • checkDistance

      public boolean checkDistance(Position otherPos, int x, int y)
      Checks if another Position is at a certain x and y offset from current Position
      Parameters:
      otherPos - the other Position to check
      x - the x offset to check
      y - the y offset to check
      Returns:
      if the offset is correct
